issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

fields.description: An Ansible+EC2 user informs me that ec2-run-instances supports the application of a client key to a set of instances with --instance-count and --client-key for a single request. This does not work with Eucalyptus: In my opinion, the AWS "Ensuring Idempotency" document is ambiguous, but it seems to me that both Eucalyptus' interpretation and AWS's interpretation make sense. Unfortunately, an interpretation that is incompatible with AWS's presents a challenge for tool developers. Here is what happens with Eucalyptus: {noformat} $ euca-run-instances -n 2-2 --client-token debug-instances-1 -k sheldonh emi-ED24394E euca-run-instances: error (RunInstancesType): javax.persistence.PersistenceException: org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not execute statement Here is a transcript extracted from a tcpdump of that request: $ euca-run-instances -n 3-3 --client-token debug-instances-1 -k sheldonh emi-ED24394E POST /services/Eucalyptus HTTP/1.1 Accept-Encoding: identity Host: 197.189.194.66:8773 Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded Content-Length: 304 User-Agent: euca2ools/3.0.2 (CPython 2.7.5; Linux 3.11.9-200.fc19.x86_64; x86_64) requestbuilder/0.1.0 requests/1.2.3 SignatureVersion=2&AWSAccessKeyId=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX&Version=2013-02-01&Timestamp=2013-12-09T07%3A46%3A01Z&MaxCount=3&Signature=XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX&ImageId=emi-ED24394E&SignatureMethod=HmacSHA256&KeyName=sheldonh&ClientToken=debug-instances-1&Action=RunInstances&MinCount=3 HTTP/1.1 406 Not Acceptable Content-Length: 76198 Content-Type: application/xml; charset=UTF-8 RunInstancesTypejavax.persistence.PersistenceException: org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not execute statementjava.lang.RuntimeException: javax.persistence.PersistenceException: org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not execute statement Caused by: javax.persistence.PersistenceException: org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not execute statement Caused by: org.hibernate.exception.ConstraintViolationException: could not execute statement Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "uk_i708ukyrek3y0ktmkawqp1yeu" Detail: Key (metadata_vm_client_token_unique)=(182270793984:debug-instances-1) already exists. java.lang.RuntimeException: comments.body: This is a bug in eucalyptus, we should be including the reservation index in the unique client token (for example)

I'm not familiar with Eucalyptus release engineering. Will this be
backported to 3.4.x, or would I need to wait for 4.0?

On Mon, Dec 16, 2013 at 8:34 PM, Steve Jones (JIRA)

[~kedwards], I think this fix will commit to the 3.4 branch cleanly, please consider for the 3.4.2 release.

[~sheldonh], we'll see if we can get this fix into a 3.4.x release.

Fix Verified in 4.0

Installed Packages

Arch        : x86_64
